uk.ac.ebi.masscascade.core

Class ContainerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.masscascade.core.ContainerFactory

  • public class ContainerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory class for constructing Container and Container implementations. Instances can be created by registering a construction key (ContainerFactory.ConstructorKey) with a corresponding creator (ContainerFactory.Creator). In most cases a class can simply be registered by providing an interface and an implementation register(Class, Class).

    Internally the factory stores the object creators in a symbol table which allows near constant time access for all registered classes.

    In cases of a non-direct parameter match (e.g. RawContainer(RawContainer) can resolve to RawContainer(FileRawContainer)) the constructor is matched by invoking find(ConstructorKey). If a constructor was found the new key will be registered with cache to avoid the overhead of finding the correct constructor again.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ContainerFactory.BasicCreator<T>
      A simple creator that helps in creating an anonymous classes for a creator.
      static class  ContainerFactory.ConstructorKey
      A class which encapsulates the information about an interface (of this implementation) and the parameter types of the constructor.
      static interface  ContainerFactory.CreationModifier<T>
      An interface that allows posterior modification of an instance after it has been created.
      static interface  ContainerFactory.Creator<T>
      An interface that wraps object creation via the ContainerFactory.Creator.create(Object[]) method.
      protected static class  ContainerFactory.DefaultInterfaceProvider
      A default interface provider implementation that simply returns the classes from Class.getInterfaces().
      static interface  ContainerFactory.InterfaceProvider
      An interface that can provide which interfaces the given class implements.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContainerFactory

        public ContainerFactory(ContainerFactory.InterfaceProvider interfaceProvider,
                int n)
        Create a new default factory with an expected number of registered classes and an interface provider. The interface provider is used when registering an implementation without a specified interface register(Class).
        Parameters:
        interfaceProvider - provides the interfaces of a given implementation class
        n - the expected number of constructors that will be stored.
        See Also:
        ContainerFactory(int)

      • ContainerFactory

        public ContainerFactory(int n)
        Create a new default factory with an expected number of registered classes and a default interface provider. The default interface provider simply invokes Class.getInterfaces() when registering an implementation without an explicit interface register(Class).
        Parameters:
        n - the expected number of constructors that will be stored.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public <T extends Container> boolean register(java.lang.Class<? extends T> impl)
        Registers a class with the factory. The interfaces of the class will be checked to see if they are CDK interfaces before they are registered. This method is provided for utility but will register the implementation with all valid interfaces. If a restricted registration is required then the safer register(Class, Class) can be used.
        Parameters:
        impl - a concrete class
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if a non-concrete class is registered
        See Also:
        register(Class, Class), register(Class, java.lang.reflect.Constructor), register(ContainerFactory.ConstructorKey, ContainerFactory.Creator)

      • register

        public <T extends Container> boolean register(java.lang.Class<T> intf,
                                     java.lang.Class<? extends T> impl)
        Explicitly register a concrete class with a provided interface. The ContainerFactory.Creator will be automatically created for all public constructors.
        Parameters:
        intf - the interface class to register
        impl - the concrete class which should implement the interface class
        Returns:
        whether registration was successful

      • register

        public <S extends Container,T extends S> boolean register(java.lang.Class<S> intf,
                                                 java.lang.Class<T> impl,
                                                 ContainerFactory.CreationModifier<T> modifier)
        Explicitly register a concrete class with a provided interface and a given modifier. The ContainerFactory.Creator will be automatically created for all public constructors. The modifier is incorporated into the ContainerFactory.Creator and is invoked directly after instantiation.
        Type Parameters:
        S - interface type
        T - implementation type (must extend interface)
        Parameters:
        intf - the interface class to register
        impl - the concrete class which should implement the interface class
        modifier - modify a instance after creation
        Returns:
        whether registration was successful

        Register a specific constructor with an explicit interface.
        Type Parameters:
        S - interface type
        T - implementation type (must extend interface)
        Parameters:

        constructor - a constructor which builds the given interface
        Returns:
        whether the constructor was registered

      • register

        public <T> ContainerFactory.Creator<T> register(ContainerFactory.ConstructorKey key,
                                       ContainerFactory.Creator<T> creator)
        Register a constructor key with a defined ContainerFactory.Creator. The key defines the interface and parameters of the creation and the creator actually creates the object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of object that will be created
        Parameters:
        key - construction key, defines interface and parameter types
        creator - creates the actual object
        Returns:
        the registered creator - null if not registered

      • key

        public static ContainerFactory.ConstructorKey key(java.lang.Class<?> intf,
                                  java.lang.Class<?>... types)
        Creates a constructor key for use in accessing constructors. The key combines the interface and types in a single instance which we can then use in a map.
        Parameters:
        intf - the interface to build the key for
        types - the classes that the the constructor requires
        Returns:
        a constructor key which can be used to lookup a constructor

      • ofClass

        public <T extends Container> T ofClass(java.lang.Class<T> intf,
                              java.lang.Object... objects)
        Construct an implementation using a constructor whose parameters match that of the provided objects.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the class
        Parameters:
        intf - the interface to construct an instance of
        Returns:
        an implementation of provided interface
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the implementation can not be constructed

      • ofClass

        public <T extends Container> T ofClass(java.lang.Class<T> intf)
        Construct an implementation using the default constructor. This provides some speed boost over invoking ofClass(Class, Object...).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the class
        Parameters:
        intf - the interface to construct an instance of
        Returns:
        an implementation of provided interface constructed using the default constructor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the implementation can not be constructed

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the interface

        Returns:
